intro: Cryptocarya tomentosa var. rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved cryptocarya, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The fruit is a small, dark berry that contains several seeds.
